title: Truro
summary: Truro (/ˈtrʊəroʊ/; Cornish: Truru)[2] is a cathedral city and civil parish in Cornwall, England. It is Cornwall's county town, sole city and centre for administration, leisure and retail. Its population was recorded as 18,766 in the 2011 census.[1] People of Truro can be called Truronians.[3] It grew as a trade centre through its port and as a stannary town for the tin-mining industry. It gained city status in 1876 with the founding of the Diocese of Truro, as mainland Britain's southernmost city. Sights include the Royal Cornwall Museum, Truro Cathedral (completed in 1910), the Hall for Cornwall and Cornwall's Courts of Justice.
